entry.name: colorpalette
entry.title: Colorpalette Widget
entry.desc: Displays an array of colors based on a given color.

longdesc.p: The color palette widget displays a palette of colors given a single color. It constructs the palette by calculating dividing the hue spectrum evenly around the hue of the given color into as many parts as there are palette entries and constructing one color out of each of the calculated hue values, including the hue of the given color, while using the given color's saturation and lightness for the calculated colors.

option.name: color
option.desc: The color that forms the basis for the palette. When you set the color, the colors option is set to a palette containing the color and hue-related siblings.

option.name: showPreview
option.desc: Whether to show the preview pane.

option.name: rows
option.desc: The number of rows in which to display the pallette.

option.name: colors
option.desc: The colors to display in the palette. This is a comma-separated list of HTML RGB values. The number of colors in the palette will be adjusted to match the number of elements in the list. If the current color is the list, it will be selected.

event.name: colorpalettecreate
event.desc: Triggered when a colorpalette is created.

event.name: colorchanged
event.desc: Triggered when the selected color changes.

method.name: destroy
method.desc: Destroys a colorpalette. This causes the DOM elemenent on which it is based to be restored to the state in which it was before the widget was created. Any DOM elements created as part of the widget will be destroyed.

example.desc: A basic example of a page with a colorpalette.
